answers.author: Matthew Reges
answers.text:
This would also be a good topic for a future MindMixer forum. Just this morning I had a good nuanced discussion of the fine lines and gray areas with a non-member intern.
For myself, I've been adhering to the code of ethics as though I were a manager, by way of practice.

For myself, I've been adhering to the code of ethics as though I were a manager, by way of practice.

author: [Anonymous]
text: As the political campaign season heats up, I was hoping to get some clarity as to who the political activities section in the Code of Ethics applies to.  I am entry-level local government employee and would like to volunteer on a Federal Senate campaign.  Would I be violating the Tenet 7 in the Code of Ethics by doing this? Or does this tenet only apply to managers who are in a policy-making role?
title: Clarity on Political Activities
